title: Interference - pulse X and superpstn of X and Y

content.question: Two wave pulses, Pulse <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, are traveling along the same string. Pulse <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> at one instant of time. A short time later the centers of the two pulses coincide at a different location on the string, resulting in the displacement shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following claims about Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must be true? Assume that the two views of the string displacement have the same scale, both horizontally and vertically.

choices.label: Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must have a shorter horizontal width than Pulse <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must be propagating in the same direction as Pulse <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must be propagating at a slower speed than Pulse <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.
Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must displace the string downward.

content.answer: Pulse <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must displace the string downward.
